author: ealexjordan
body:
Quick fix that detects when symlink recursively links back to parent directory and skips recursing into that symlink rather than recursing until the limit is hit.

Does not fix more complicated symlink loops, as in sys.

DHowett
comments.body: I think this is a good start, but I'm worried it sets us off on the wrong foot for eventually supporting extended symlink chains (the likes of which don't link to directories directly under our own prefix).

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
Thanks @DHowett for your feedback. Can you plase elaborate it a bit more?
One more issue with the current fix is that it takes care of the direct recursive symbolic chains, but not indirect ones.

comments.author: DHowett
comments.body: @daxian-dbw That's what I mean; I don't think the solution in this pull request is scalable for indirect recursive symbolic link chains. The solution to that one would also fix _direct chains_, however.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: I'm closing this PR because the solution in this pull request fixes the direct symbolic chain, but not the indirect recursive symbolic link chains.
